column4: Hey, is there anyone here that can help me out? I'm having a small issue with OpenSSH.
come on just ask
Ok, well I've researched the problem for several hours and come up with nothing. I'm running Ubuntu Server and I've been trying to use password authentication instead of keys
I've edited sshd_config in several places, but I still get an error message(and no password prompt) when I try to connect.
what happen then . the system just let you in or what ?

I don't know what the issue is exactly. I just upgraded servers, and on my old one I was running Linux Mint 11. OpenSSH was configured to use password authentication out of the box, and now I simply can't get it to work
Let me c+p the message I get.
ok
@    WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED!     @
IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY!
Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)!
hehe
Well I suppose it's obvious that I'm new here :P
this is normal after reinstalation
How should I fix it? I've already restarted the SSH server
try typing
cd .ssh
in you local machine
I see a file called known_hosts
then echo "" > known_hosts
